item.comment: 3012 Simple deck building game with great art, but honestly I'd rather play Thunderstone or Ascension.

item.name: 7 Wonders
item.comment: 7 WONDERS Great theme! I like this game because it's easy to learn, has no down time, and can play up to 7.

item.name: 7 Wonders: Cities
item.comment: 7 WONDERS: CITIES I like this expansion because now you can effect players other than only the ones to your left and right.

item.name: 7 Wonders: Leaders
item.comment: 7 WONDERS: LEADERS Interesting expansion, but not as good as '7 Wonders : Cities'.

item.name: 7 Wonders: Wonder Pack
item.comment: 7 WONDERS: WONDER PACK It's a wonder they don't make more of these!

item.name: The 7th Continent
item.comment: THE 7TH CONTINENT A true "Choose Your Own Adventure" game. Fun and intriguing!

item.name: A la carte
item.comment: A LA CARTE I enjoyed this light hearted cooking game. The bits are fantastic, and really add to the theme.

item.name: Acquire
item.comment: ACQUIRE Fun once in a while.

item.name: Advance to Boardwalk
item.comment: ADVANCE TO BOARDWALK I bought this because it was different from 'Monopoly', and could play it with the kids in my family.

item.name: Age of Steam
item.comment: AGE OF STEAM I wouldn't mind playing this once a year (and that's the best I can do).

item.name: Age of War
item.comment: AGE OF WAR Nice little game with a dice rolling mechanism similar to 'Elder Sign'. Great filler!.

item.name: Agricola
item.comment: AGRICOLA After pimping up my set with animeeples, fancy resource tokens, and one additional deck, I just don't feel like playing this anymore.

item.name: Agricola L-Deck
item.comment: AGRICOLA L-DECK Not necessary to play, but cool to own. (Thanks Ilan!)

item.name: Agricola Z-Deck
item.comment: AGRICOLA Z-DECK Not necessary to play, but cool to own.

item.name: Agricola: Ö-Deck
item.comment: AGRICOLA O-DECK Not necessary to play, but cool to own. (Thanks Ilan!!)

item.name: Airlines Europe
item.comment: AIRLINES EUROPE Another great game from Alan Moon! I Like this just as much as 'Ticket to Ride'!

item.name: Alhambra: Big Box
item.comment: ALHAMBRA: BIG BOX I find this more interesting than Carcassonne. With all the expansions at your fingertips it's fun to experiment with different combinations.

item.name: Alhambra: The Magical Buildings
item.comment: ALHAMBRA: THE MAGICAL BUILDINGS Fun promo to throw in the tile bag.

item.name: Alien Frontiers
item.comment: ALIEN FRONTIERS I like how the dice are used as spaceships. I dislike all the iconography on the board because I keep forgetting what it means!

item.name: Alien Frontiers: Faction Pack #1
item.comment: ALIEN FRONTIERS: FACTION PACK #1 I like the little buggy you can drive around the planet.

item.name: Alien Frontiers: Factions
item.comment: ALIEN FRONTIERS: FACTIONS I like the added dice for fifth player, but the factions themselves fell flat for me.

item.name: Alien Frontiers: The Mind Control Helmet
item.comment: ALIEN FRONTIERS: MIND CONTROL HELMET Like most promos it's not necessary, but cool to have!

item.name: Among the Stars
item.comment: AMONG THE STARS I like the gameplay, but not the artwork.

item.name: Amun-Re
item.comment: AMUN RE Good game.

item.name: Android
item.comment: ANDROID An epic game with a theme similar to "Blade Runner". It can be complicated to play, but is a very good gaming experience.

item.name: Android: Netrunner
item.comment: ANDROID: NETRUNNER This game can be a real mind freak. Difficult to learn.

item.name: Apples to Apples
item.comment: APPLES TO APPLES I'm getting tired of this, but the family still enjoys it.
item.conditiontext: Like new, no card or shelf wear. No wooden box either.

item.name: AquaSphere
item.comment: AQUASPHERE Very puzzle like at imes, this game has a great theme and is lots of fun.

item.name: Archer: The Danger Zone! Board Game
item.comment: ARCHER: THE DANGER ZONE BOARD GAME Garbage.

item.name: Arctic Scavengers: Base Game+HQ+Recon
item.comment: ARCTIC SCAVENGERS Fun deck builder in which you truly feel like you're in an ice age trying to fend off other tribes and survive.

item.name: Arkham Horror
item.comment: ARKHAM HORROR This is one of the best games I have ever played! The theme is FANTASTIC, and the entire production is just beautiful! An adventure in a game box!

item.name: Arkham Horror: Curse of the Dark Pharaoh Expansion
item.comment: ARKHAM HORROR: CURSE OF THE DARK PHARAOH I love these small expansions because you can quickly pop in a scenario.

item.name: Arkham Horror: Dunwich Horror Expansion
item.comment: ARKHAM HORROR: DUNWICH HORROR Excellent big box expansion. I like adding another city next to Arkham to adventure in!

item.name: Arkham Horror: Innsmouth Horror Expansion
item.comment: ARKHAM HORROR: INNSMOUTH HORROR The Deep Ones are pretty cool.

item.name: Arkham Horror: Kingsport Horror Expansion
item.comment: ARKHAM HORROR: KINGSPORT HORROR The Guardians are a neat idea.

item.name: Arkham Horror: Miskatonic Horror Expansion
item.comment: ARKHAM HORROR: MISKATONIC HORROR EXPANSION Tons of cards for use with every expansion.

item.name: Arkham Horror: The Black Goat of the Woods Expansion
item.comment: ARKHAM HORROR: BLACK GOAT OF THE WOODS I love these small expansions because you can quickly pop in a scenario.

item.name: Arkham Horror: The Curse of the Dark Pharaoh Expansion (Revised Edition)
item.comment: ARKHAM HORROR: THE CURSE OF THE DARK PHARAOH EXPANSION (REVISED EDITION) I was doubful about why they needed to revise this in the first place, but after seeing it I undersand. The new cards and tokens are a drastic improvement!

item.name: Arkham Horror: The King in Yellow Expansion
item.comment: ARKHAM HORROR THE KING IN YELLOW I love these small expansions because you can quickly pop in a scenario.

item.name: Arkham Horror: The Lurker at the Threshold Expansion
item.comment: ARKHAM HORROR: THE LURKER AT THE THRESHOLD I love these small expansions because you can quickly pop in a scenario.

item.name: Artifacts, Inc.
item.comment: ARTIFACTS INC I like this card game about collecting relics in the 20's. The artork is quite attractive!

item.name: Ascending Empires
item.comment: ASCENDING EMPIRES Sci Fi game with a unique starship flicking mechanism.

item.name: Ascension: Dawn of Champions
item.comment: ASCENSION: DAWN OF CHAMPIONS Same game we all know (and love), but now with champions, reputation, and what I think is the best art of the series.

item.name: Ascension: Deckbuilding Game
item.comment: ASCENSION: CHRONICLE OF THE GODSLAYER Probably the easiest deck building game. Simple yet fun.

item.name: Ascension: Realms Unraveled
item.comment: ASCENSION: REALMS UNRAVELED No matter how they tweak each new 'Ascension' set, it'š still a lot of fun!

item.name: Ascension: Rise of Vigil
item.comment: ASCENSION: RISE OF VIGIL Good game, but the insert is horrible.

item.name: Ascension: Year One Collector's Edition
item.comment: ASCENSION: YEAR ONE COLLECTOR'S EDITION If you absolutely love Ascension this is the version to get. The game plays exactly the same, but the cards are all foil.

item.name: Augustus
item.comment: RISE OF AUGUSTUS Fun worker placement game.

item.name: Automobile
item.comment: AUTOMOBILE I'm not big on Eurogames, but this one did have an interesting theme.

item.name: Axis & Allies
item.comment: AXIS & ALLIES I prefer the original vs the newer editions.

item.name: Axis & Allies: D-Day
item.comment: Axis & Allies: D-Day I like this steamlined version of A&A because it doesn't take as long as the original.

item.name: Aye, Dark Overlord!
item.comment: AYE, DARK OVERLORD Very nice artwork on the cards, but little else.

item.name: Backgammon
item.comment: BACKGAMMON I don't usually like abstract strategy games, but this one is really fun. You could probably play 3 games in under 30 minutes. I play this with my Dad frequently, and we enjoy it.

item.name: BANG! The Dice Game
item.comment: BANG! THE DICE GAME Quick, fun, and better than the card game.

item.name: Battlestar Galactica
item.comment: BATTLESTAR GALACTICA Not bad. Watched the series in the 70's, but not the new one on the SciFi Channel. Probably would have enjoyed it more if I had. I would try it again. UPDATE:Tried this again, and it is really good with the right group! This also prompted me to watch the new series.

item.name: Battlestar Galactica: Pegasus Expansion
item.comment: BATTLESTAR GALACTICA: PEGASUS EXPANSION Very good expansion. I like it because it gives you more options on your turn.

item.name: Belfort
item.comment: BELFORT Trying to collect enough resources to build various buildings across the map is very interesting. Nice board too.

item.name: Betrayal at House on the Hill
item.comment: BETRAYAL AT HOUSE ON THE HILL Fun haunted house game with a traitor aspect thrown in.

item.name: Blink
item.comment: BLINK A real stinker.

item.name: Blokus
item.comment: BLOKUS Quick abstract game with nice bits.

item.name: Blokus Trigon
item.comment: BLOKUS TRIGON The triangles make this frustrating. The original Blokus is a better game.

item.name: Boggle
item.comment: BOGGLE One of the few word games I don't mind playing (occasionally).

item.name: Bohnanza
item.comment: BOHNANZA This game seems to hit the table at Christmas, and is known by the non-gamers in my family as the "Beano game".

item.name: Boomtown
item.comment: BOOMTOWN This is a really fun card game about mining in the wild west. Great design!

item.name: Boss Monster: The Dungeon Building Card Game
item.comment: BOSS MONSTER If I wanted to play a game with 8 bit graphics, I'd haul out my old Nintendo!

item.name: Ca$h 'n Gun$
item.comment: CA$H 'N GUN$ This is such a fun party game! Fast and furious, it's like being in a Quentin Tarantino movie!

item.name: Ca$h 'n Guns (second edition)
item.comment: CASH 'N GUNS (SECOND EDITION) Reasons why I like this better than the 1st ediion: Better artwork More varied loot (gems, paintings, cash, first aid kits, and extra bullets) Character cards Plays 8 instead of 6 Drafting of loot Glad I switched!

item.name: Ca$h 'n Guns: More Cash 'n More Guns
item.comment: CASH N' GUNS: MORE CASH N' MORE GUNS What a great little expansion! More cash, more guns, and some great new mechanisms and special powers!

item.name: Can't Stop
item.comment: CAN'T STOP I can't stop playing this great dice game!

item.name: Can't Stop: Rollin' Down the Highway
item.comment: CAN'T STOP: ROLLIN' DOWN THE HIGHWAY A fun,inexpensive, and easy way to change how 'Can't Stop' plays.

item.name: Canterbury
item.comment: CANTERBURY Much too abstract for me.

item.name: Carcassonne
item.comment: CARCASSONNE A classic. Easy to learn, and quick to play.

item.name: Carcassonne: Abbey & Mayor
item.comment: CARCASSONNE: ABBEY & MAYOR Simple expansion. No big deal.

item.name: Carcassonne: Inns & Cathedrals
item.comment: CARCASSONNE: INNS & CATHEDRALS I prefer to play 'Carcassonne' with at least this set and Traders & Builders.

item.name: Carcassonne: The Discovery
item.comment: CARCASSONNE: THE DISCOVERY Fun variation of regular 'Carcassonne', with the major difference being in the scoring.

item.name: Carcassonne: The Mini Expansion
item.comment: CARCASSONNE: THE MINI EXPANSION Not a biggie. Just chuck 12 new tiles into your 'Carcassonne' box.

item.name: Carcassonne: The Princess & the Dragon
item.comment: CARCASSONNE: THE PRINCESS & THE DRAGON I like how the dragon eats your opponent's meeples.

item.name: Carcassonne: The River
item.comment: CARCASSONNE: THE RIVER Alternate way to start the game.

item.name: Carcassonne: The River II
item.comment: CARCASSONNE: THE RIVER II More tiles.

item.name: Carcassonne: The Tower
item.comment: CARCASSONNE: THE TOWER Now you can capture your opponent's meeples and throw them in the tower (where they belong!)

item.name: Carcassonne: Traders & Builders
item.comment: CARCASSONNE: TRADERS & BUILDERS I prefer to play 'Carcassonne' with at least this set and Inns & Cathedrals.

item.name: Cards Against Humanity
item.comment: CARDS AGAINST HUMANITY The dirty version of 'Apples to Apples'. Utterly filthy, but absolutely hilarious!

item.name: Cartagena
item.comment: CARTAGENA It's literally 'Candy Land' with pirates.

item.name: Castaways
item.comment: CASTAWAYS Pros: Fun, good theme, nice bits, good overall production. Cons: Rules are a mess, game can be very long, semi-cooperative play seems anti-thematic.

item.name: Castle Panic
item.comment: CASTLE PANIC Fast and fun co-op game. Almost a filler.

item.name: Castle Panic: The Wizard's Tower
item.comment: CASTLE PANIC: THE WIZARD'S TOWER Icreases the complexity and difficulty of'Castle Panic'.

item.name: The Castles of Burgundy
item.comment: THE CASTLES OF BURGANDY A Eurogame with dice.

item.name: Castles of Mad King Ludwig
item.comment: CASTLES OF MAD KING LUDWIG I like this game because it's fun to build your own castle with the attractive room tiles. Easy to learn and play too. I'd rather play this than 'Suburbia' anytime.

item.name: Catan Scenarios: Frenemies
item.comment: CATAN SCENARIOS: FRENEMIES Fun mini expansion that's easy to throw in.

item.name: Catan: Cities & Knights – 5-6 Player Extension
item.comment: CITIES & KNIGHTS OF CATAN 5-6 PLAYER EXPANSION Good, but 5 and 6 players can really slow down the game.

item.name: Catan: Traders & Barbarians
item.comment: CATAN: TRADERS & BARBARIANS Fun once in a while.

item.name: Catch Phrase!
item.comment: CATCH PHRASE Great party game! I have the original "analog" edition.

item.name: Caverna: The Cave Farmers
item.comment: CAVERNA: THE CAVE FARMERS More streamlined and less punishing (therefore more fun) than 'Agricola'. Also there is so mucch to do and so many different strategies. Very good game!

item.name: Caylus
item.comment: CAYLUS For a game with such promise at first, I tired of this quickly. But after not playing this for a long time I now find it fun once in a while.

item.name: Chaosmos
item.comment: CHAOSMOS Nothing special.

item.name: Cheesonomics
item.comment: CHEESONOMICS Ugh, terrible.

item.name: Chicago Express
item.comment: CHICAGO EXPRESS I really hate train games.

item.name: ChronoSphere
item.comment: CHRONOSPHERE A great game for family and gamers alike.

item.name: Citadels
item.comment: CITADELS I like the great artwork and bits in this role-selection card game. Also try 'Mission Red Planet' by the same designers.

item.name: The Cities and Knights of Catan
item.comment: CITIES & KNIGHTS OF CATAN If you find 'Settlers of Catan' getting bland, then this may spice things up.

item.name: Clue
item.comment: CLUE Again, another game I keep around for when the kids come over. My set is from the 70's, and I like the style. I even own another set were the revolver is actually a .45!

item.name: Clue Master Detective
item.comment: CLUE MASTER DETECTIVE This is the set I prefer when the adults want to play 'Clue'. The addition of more suspects, weapons, and rooms makes it a more substancial playing experience. Plus the board is gorgeous!

item.name: Codenames
item.comment: CODENAMES Very clever and very fun!

item.name: Colosseum
item.comment: COLOSSEUM Great production, and lots of fun!

item.name: Colt Express
item.comment: COLT EXPRESS This game looks great on a table. Moving the outlaws and loot tokens can be a bit fiddly though.

item.name: Compounded
item.comment: COMPOUNDED A light Euro about chemistry and working in a lab. Great bits and lots of fun.

item.name: Core Worlds
item.comment: CORE WORLDS Great sci fi deck building game. Very attractive artwork!

item.name: Core Worlds: Galactic Orders
item.comment: CORE WORLDS:GALACTIC ORDERS This expansion really improves 'Core Worlds' by giving players many more ways to recruit, deploy, and gain energy.

item.name: Core Worlds: Revolution
item.comment: CORE WORLDS: REVOLUTION This adds more ships, infantry. worlds. events, and advancements for the worlds. Plus special hero tactic decks.

item.name: Cosmic Encounter
item.comment: COSMIC ENCOUNTER This is a great, light, sci-fi game. It's different every time, and always exciting to the finish!

item.name: Cosmic Encounter: Cosmic Alliance
item.comment: COSMIC ENCOUNTER: COSMIC ALLIANCE Interesting alliance rules for team play, and more cool aliens!

item.name: Cosmic Encounter: Cosmic Conflict
item.comment: COSMIC ENCOUNTER: COSMIC CONFLICT With more aliens, hazard cards, and pieces for a 6th player, how can this not be great?!

item.name: Cosmic Encounter: Cosmic Dominion
item.comment: COSMIC ENCOUNTER: COSMIC DOMINION Great expansion! I like the tokens that can make one of your ships a flagship.

item.name: Cosmic Encounter: Cosmic Incursion
item.comment: COSMIC ENCOUNTER:COSMIC INCURSION I love the reward deck, and of course MORE ALIENS!!

item.name: Cosmic Encounter: Cosmic Storm
item.comment: COSMIC ENCOUNTER: COSMIC STORM Oh yeah! Space stations and a ton of new aliens too!

item.name: Coup
item.comment: COUP Set in the same world as 'The Resistance, this card game reminds me of 'Love Letter' a bit. I recommend using the expansion.

item.name: Coup: Reformation
item.comment: COUP: REFORMATION Highly enhances 'Coup'! Helps avoid those circumstances when everyone knows who will win 4 turns before the actual end of the game.

item.name: Cthulhu Wars
item.comment: CTHULHU WARS The figures in this game are stunning!

item.name: Curse of the Mummy's Tomb
item.comment: CURSE OF THE MUMMY's TOMB Really cool theme, and fantastic miniatures. Unfortunately the game's mechanisms, and 3D board are bad.

item.name: Cutthroat Caverns
item.comment: CUTTHROAT CAVERNS Boy this sure looked fun...what a disappointment. It's just not very exciting.

item.name: Cutthroat Caverns: Deeper & Darker
item.comment: CUTTHROAT CAVERNS: DEEPER & DARKER Offers more encounters and special powers that the characters can use once per game. If I liked the game this would be great.

item.name: Cutthroat Caverns: Fresh Meat
item.comment: CUTTHROAT CAVERNS: FRESH MEAT More of everything, and a great big box that holds the CC game plus all expansions. Just don't turn it on it's side!

item.name: Cutthroat Caverns: Relics & Ruin
item.comment: CUTTHROAT CAVERNS: RELICS & RUIN More stuff than I need. Good otherwise.

item.name: Cutthroat Caverns: Tombs & Tomes
item.comment: CUTTHROAT CAVERNS: TOMBS & TOMES Adds more stuff from past expansions, and an adventure book I could do without.

item.name: Cyclades
item.comment: CYCLADES Despite the unique theme, monster minis, and cool artwork, this game just fell flat with me.

item.name: Dark Tower
item.comment: DARK TOWER Doesn't stand up after all these years, but still brought back memories.

item.name: Darkest Night
item.comment: DARKEST NIGHT Only a partial play.

item.name: DC Comics Deck-Building Game
item.comment: DC COMICS DECK BUILDING GAME Good artwork, but nothing special.

item.name: Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game
item.comment: DEAD OF WINTER: A CROSSROADS GAME I apppreciate the storytelling aspect of this game. It can get very exciting and tense!

item.name: Defenders of the Realm
item.comment: DEFENDERS OF THE REALM With great theme, cool minis, and Larry Elmore artwork, what else could you ask for?

item.name: Deluxe Edition Scrabble Brand Crossword Game
item.comment: DELUXE SCRABBLE About once every few years I get roped into playing this. When I finally need the space for other games, OUT IT GOES!

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)
item.comment: DESCENT: JOURNEYS IN THE DARK (SECOND EDITION) A stellar production! With easy to learn rules and fantastic components this immersive game will have you deep into adventuring in minutes!

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Alric Farrow Lieutenant Pack
item.comment: DESCENT: JOURNEYS IN THE DARK (SECOND EDITION) ALRIC FARROW LIEUTENANT PACK I hate using a token for the lieutenant when everything else is a nice miniature.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Ariad Lieutenant Pack
item.comment: DESCENT: JOURNEYS IN THE DARK (SECOND EDITION) ARIAD LIEUTENANT PACK I hate using a token for the lieutenant when everything else is a nice miniature.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Belthir Lieutenant Pack
item.comment: DESCENT: JOURNEYS IN THE DARK (SECOND EDITION) BELHIR LIEUTENANT PACK I hate using a token for the lieutenant when everything else is a nice miniature. Very nice design!

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Bol'Goreth Lieutenant Pack
item.comment: DESCENT: JOURNEYS IN THE DARK (SECOND EDITION) BOL'GORETH LIEUTENANT PACK I hate using a token for the lieutenant when everything else is a nice miniature. Excellent model!

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Bonds of the Wild
item.comment: DESCENT: JOURNEYS IN THE DARK (SECOND EDITON) BONDS OF THE WILD (Kobolds, Hellhounds, and Deep Elves) I love the kobold hoarde (12 minis!), and how three of the new heroes have cool familiars.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Crown of Destiny
item.comment: DESCENT: JOURNEYS IN THE DARK (SECOND EDITION) CROWN OF DESTINY (Giants, Chaos Beasts, and Lava Beetles) I'm really enjoying the hero & monster packs. It's fun to own revamped figures from the 1st edition.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Crusade of the Forgotten
item.comment: DESCENT: JOURNEYS IN THE DARK (SECOND EDITION) CRUSADE OF THE FORGOTTEN (Golems, Medusae, and Sorcerers) I really love increasing my "stable" of monsters!

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Eliza Farrow Lieutenant Pack
item.comment: DESCENT: JOURNEYS IN THE DARK (SECOND EDITION) ELIZA FARROW LIEUTENANT PACK I hate using a token for the lieutenant when everything else is a nice miniature.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Gargan Mirklace Lieutenant Pack
item.comment: DESCENT: JOURNEYS IN THE DARK (SECOND EDITION) MIRKLACE LIEUTENANT PACK I hate using a token for the lieutenant when everything else is a nice miniature.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Guardians of Deephall
item.comment: DESCENT: JOURNEYS IN THE DARK (SECOND EDITION) GUARDIANS OF DEEPHALL (Crypt Dragons, Wendigos, and Dark Priests) It's always good to get more monsters!

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Heirs of Blood
item.comment: DESCENT: JOURNEYS IN THE DARK (SECOND EDITION) HEIRS OF BLOOD I've been waiting for this for a long time, and it was well worth it.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Labyrinth of Ruin
item.comment: DESCENT: JOURNEYS IN THE DARK (SECOND EITION) LABYRINTH OF RUIN This is just great! More characters, monsters, lieutenants, and a brand new campaign!

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Lair of the Wyrm
item.comment: DESCENT: JOURNEYS IN THE DARK (SECOND EDITION) LAIR OF THE WRYM More of everything I love about 'Descent' especially new quests.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Manor of Ravens
item.comment: DESCENT:JOURNEYS IN THE DARK (SECOND EDITION) MANOR OF RAVENS Finally a haunted house to adventure in. The wraith mini is beautiful!

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Merick Farrow Lieutenant Pack
item.comment: DESCENT: JOURNEYS N THE DARK (SECOND EDITION) MERICK FARROW LIEUTENANT PACK I hate using a token for the lieutenant when everything else is a nice miniature.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Oath of the Outcast
item.comment: DESCENT:JOURNEYS IN THE DARK (SECOND EDITION)- OATH OF THE OUTCAST (Bane Spiders, Beastmen, and Razor Wings) I bought this solely for the monsters. Those heroes are geting awfully lucky lately...

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Queen Ariad Lieutenant Pack
item.comment: DESCENT: JOURNEYS IN THE DARK (SECOND EDITION) QUEEN ARIAD LIEUTENANT PACK I hate using a token for the lieutenant when everything else is a nice miniature.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Raythen Lieutenant Pack
item.comment: DESCENT: JOURNEYS IN THE DARK (SECOND EDITION) RAYTHEN LIEUTENANT PACK I hate using a token for the lieutenant when everything else is a nice miniature. The fact that you can use him as a hero is a nice plus.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Rylan Olliven Lieutenant Pack
item.comment: DESCENT: JOURNEYS IN THE DARK(SECOND EDITION) RYLAN OLLIVEN LIEUTENANT PACK I hate using a token for the lieutenant when everything else is a nice miniature.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Serena Lieutenant Pack
item.comment: DESCENT: JOURNEYS IN THE DARK (SECOND EDITION) SERENA LIEUTENANT PACK I hate using a token for the lieutenant when everything else is a nice miniature. The fact that you can use her as a hero is a nice plus.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Shadow of Nerekhall
item.comment: DESCENT: JOURNEYS IN THE DARK (SECOND EDITION) SHADOW OF NEREKHALL New camaign, and more of everything I love about 'Descent'. (which is everything!)

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Skarn Lieutenant Pack
item.comment: DESCENT: JOURNEYS IN THE DARK (SECOND EDITION) SKARN LIEUTENANT PACK I hate using a token for the lieutenant when everything else is a nice mini.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Splig Lieutenant Pack
item.comment: DESCENT: JOURNEYS IN THE DARK (SECOND EDITION) SPLIG LIEUTENANT PACK I hate using a token for the lieutenant when everything else is a nice miniature. This "fat goblin" looks pretty cool.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – The Trollfens
item.comment: DESCENT: JOURNEYS IN THE DARK (SECOND EDITION) THE TROLLFENS More of everyting I love about 'Descent' especially new quests!

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Tristayne Olliven Lieutenant Pack
item.comment: DESCENT: JOURNEYS IN THE DARK(SECOND EDITION) TRISTAYNE OLLIVEN LIEUTENANT PACK I hate using a token for the lieutenant when everything else is a nice miniature.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Valyndra Lieutenant Pack
item.comment: DESCENT: JOURNEYS IN THE DARK (SECOND EDITION) VALYNDRA LIEUTENANT PACK I hate using a token for the lieutenant whem everything else is a nice miniature, and Valyndra is my favorite.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Verminous Lieutenant Pack
item.comment: DESCENT:JOURNEYS IN THE DARK (SECOND EDITION) VERMINOUS LIEUTENANT PACK I hate using a token for the lieutenant when everything else is a nice miniature.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Visions of Dawn
item.comment: DESCENT: JOURNEYS IN THE ARK (SECOND EDITION) VISONS OF DAWN (Ogres, Trolls, and Manticores) I got this to increase my "stable" of monsters for the game.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Zachareth Lieutenant Pack
item.comment: DESCENT: JOURNEYS IN THE DARK (SECOND EDITION) ZACHARETH LIEUTENANT PACK I hate using a token for the lieutenant when everything else is a nice miniature.

item.name: Deus
item.comment: DEUS My complaint is that a couple of the resource colors don't match what's on the cards. The iconography can be a pain to remember between plays.

item.name: Diamonds
item.comment: DIAMONDS I generally don't like trick-taking games, but this one is a blast to play!

item.name: Dice City
item.comment: DICE CITY ATTRACTIVE AND FUN. BEST WITH THREE TO KEEP TURN LENGTH TO A MINIMUM.

item.name: Dice Town
item.comment: DICE TOWN Good family game that combines poker dice with a light wild west theme.

item.name: Diplomacy
item.comment: DIPLOMACY Not fun in any way.

item.name: Dominion
item.comment: DOMINION I like the ever changing strategies that comes with using different cards every game. Lots of replayability!

item.name: Dominion: Adventures
item.comment: DOMINION ADVENTURES When they announced this expansion I wasn't too impressed, but after playing it I think it's very good. lots of new cards and some interesting new mechanisms too.

item.name: Dominion: Black Market Promo Card
item.comment: DOMINION: BLACK MARKET PROMO Interesting card. Glad to have.

item.name: Dominion: Cornucopia
item.comment: DOMINION: CORNUCOPIA Best of the small box expansions (at least so far).

item.name: Dominion: Dark Ages
item.comment: DOMINION: DARK AGES Your kingdom has fallen on hard times and everyone is trying to rebuild in this rags to riches expansion. A very unique and fun twist on 'Dominion'!

item.name: Dominion: Envoy Promo Card
item.comment: DOMINION: ENVOY PROMO CARD Real cool! Glad to have.

item.name: Dominion: Governor Promo Card
item.comment: DOMINION: GOVERNOR PROMO CARD Always good to own Dominion promos.

item.name: Dominion: Hinterlands
item.comment: DOMINION: HINTERLANDS I thought this was the last expansion for Dominion, now I hear there's more!

item.name: Dominion: Intrigue
item.comment: DOMINION: INTRIGUE A great expansion, lots of interaction.

item.name: Dominion: Prosperity
item.comment: DOMINION: PROSPERITY By far my favorite expansion. Who doesn't love lots of treasure?

item.name: Dominion: Seaside
item.comment: DOMINION: SEASIDE I like the theme of this expansion, and the cards that use the new metal VP tokens.

item.name: Dominion: Stash Promo Card
item.comment: DOMINION: STASH PROMO CARD Like most promo cards just cool to own.

item.name: Dominion: Walled Village Promo Card
item.comment: DOMINION: WALLED VILLAGE PROMO CARD Keep the promo cards coming and I'll buy 'em!

item.name: Dragon Slayer
item.comment: DRAGON SLAYER Fun dice game along the lines of 'Martian Dice'.

item.name: Dread Curse
item.comment: DREAD CURSE Featuring role selection similar to 'Citadels', this light game proves you can never trust another pirate when it comes to a big bag of gold.

item.name: Dungeon Lords
item.comment: DUNGEON LORDS Great theme, but too long for what it is.

item.name: Dungeon Petz
item.comment: DUNGEON PETZ Great theme and so much shorter than 'Dungeon Lords'.

item.name: Dungeon Roll
item.comment: DUNGEON ROLL Another fun dice game from Tasty Minstrel Games. Very nice dice!

item.name: Dungeon Run
item.comment: DUNGEON RUN I like the innovative combat system with the "exploding" dice. Always exciting to the finish!

item.name: Dungeon!
item.comment: DUNGEON! I loved this game as a teenager, unfortunately it's kind of plain by today's standards.

item.name: DungeonQuest
item.comment: DUNGEONQUEST (FIRST ED.) A cool dungeon romp that stands up 30 years after it's initial release. However, the new 3rd edition is better in every way.

item.name: DungeonQuest (third edition)
item.comment: DUNGEONQUEST (THIRD ED.) Beautiful reprint of 'Dungeonquest'. I got this for the upgraded components, and after seeing how nice the new edition is I probably won't play the original again.

item.name: Dungeonquest: Catacombs
item.comment: DUNGEONQUEST: CATACOMBS It's hard to track your progress through the dungeon when you go underground (below the board). The snotlings are cool though!

item.name: Dungeonquest: Heroes
item.comment: HEROES FOR DUNGEONQUEST The addition of more player characters and abilities increases the fun and replayability of 'Dungeonquest'.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Battle for Faerûn
item.comment: DUNGEONS & DRAGONS DICE MASTERS I was pleasantly surprised by this game. It's much better than 'Quarriors' despite the similarities.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Conquest of Nerath Board Game
item.comment: D&D: CONQUEST OF NERATH Victory points, special powers, and tons of really cool minis make this Risk-like game lots of fun!

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Wrath of Ashardalon Board Game
item.comment: D&D: WRATH OF ASHARDALON I really like this card driven D&D game with its' various scenarios and tons of minis.

item.name: Durch die Wüste
item.comment: DURCH DIE WUSTE (THROUGH THE DESERT) The first Eurogame I bought. Everybody always loves the pastel colored camels!

item.name: Eclipse
item.comment: ECLIPSE This is not 'Twilight Imperium'-lite! It's just another damn Eurogame.

item.name: Eggs and Empires
item.comment: EGGS AND EMPIRES Simple fun.

item.name: Eight-Minute Empire: Legends
item.comment: EIGHT MINUTE EMPIRES: LEGENDS Fun, fast area control game that's a great way to top off a long night of gaming.

item.name: Elder Sign
item.comment: ELDER SIGN The 'Arkham Horror' dice game! Short play time is a plus too.

item.name: Elder Sign: The Log of the Persephone – Promo Location
item.comment: ELDER SIGN: THE LOG OF THE PERSEPHONE While nothing special, this promo card given out on Tabletop day is still nice to have.

item.name: Elder Sign: Unseen Forces
item.comment: ELDER SIGN: UNSEEN FORCES I like the cool new dice, they make the game more challenging.

item.name: Eldritch Horror
item.comment: ELDRITCH HORROR I like this new game set in the 'Arkham Horror' universe. It's similar enough to attract Arkham fans, and different enough to appeal to its' detractors. I don't think it replaces Arkham, but rather compliments it.

item.name: Eldritch Horror: Forsaken Lore
item.comment: ELDRITCH HORROR: FORSAKEN LORE The cards in this expansion greatly increase the replayability of the game.

item.name: Eldritch Horror: Mountains of Madness
item.comment: ELDRITCH HORROR: MOUNTAINS OF MADNESS This is the perfect size "big" expansion. With a small Anarctica side board, more characters, two new ancient ones, and a ton of new encounter cards what's not to love?

item.name: Elemental Clash: The Basic Set
item.comment: ELEMENTAL CLASH Stinks.

item.name: Elfenland
item.comment: ELFENLAND Decent game. I never did find a copy of 'Elfengold' so I could recreate the now out of print 'Elfenroads'.

item.name: Eminent Domain
item.comment: EMINENT DOMAIN This game reminds me of Race for the Galaxy. At least there's writing on the cards instead of icons.

item.name: Endeavor
item.comment: ENDEAVOUR Good game.

item.name: Evo
item.comment: EVO I like this dinosaur themed game! The first edition is vastly superior to the second.

item.name: Evolution
item.comment: EVOLUTION Easy spieces survival gaame involving special ower cards, and a grab for the most food (points). What I like best is the big, chunky Brontosaurus meeple that is used as a first layer token!

item.name: Faces
item.comment: FACES The faces on the cards will have everyone laughing!

item.name: Farmageddon
item.comment: FARMAGEDDON Similar to 'Bohnanza', but nowhere near as good. Fun on occassion.

item.name: Finca
item.comment: FINCA With attractive bits and simple strategic gameplay, Finca is suitable for gamers and non-gamers alike.

item.name: Fist of Dragonstones
item.comment: FIST OF DRAGONSTONES The components are beautiful, but this blind auction game is boring.

item.name: Five Tribes
item.comment: FIVE TRIBES Fun at first, but after a few plays the game feels like one big puzzle. There is NO WAY to plan ahead until it is actually your turn so downtime is a killer.

item.name: Flash Point: Fire Rescue
item.comment: FLASH POINT: FIRE RESCUE The basic game is good, but the experienced rules are where this game really shines. The plastic firemen are really cool!

item.name: Flash Point: Fire Rescue – 2nd Story
item.comment: FLASH POINT: FIRE RESCUE- 2ND STORY EXPANSION New 2 story buildings for your firefighting pleasure.

item.name: Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Urban Structures
item.comment: FLASH POINT: FIRE RESCUE- URBAN STRUCTURES Brownstone and high rise buildings for even more fire fighting fun.

item.name: Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Veteran and Rescue Dog
item.comment: FLASH POINT: FIRE RESCUE VETERAN AND RESCUE DOG Two fun new characters to add to your firefighting arsenal. Kids love to play the dog, and he can be quite useful.

item.name: Fleet
item.comment: FLEET A great little game! I like the theme of building fishing fleets, and the game componets are attractive. I reccomend buying the fish meeples, but then again I'm a sucker for fish meeples!

item.name: Fleet: Arctic Bounty
item.comment: FLEET: ARCTIC BOUNTY If you love 'Fleet' getting this is a no-brainer! If you do, get the fish meeples. You won't be disappointed.

item.name: Flinch
item.comment: FLINCH Very plain card game.

item.name: Floating Market
item.comment: FLOATING MARKET Fun Euro with lots of dice.

item.name: For Sale
item.comment: FOR SALE Fun. but very simple.

item.name: Forbidden Desert
item.comment: FORBIDDEN DESERT Very good co-op. Double the fun by playing after 'Forbidden Island' (if you survive.)

item.name: Forbidden Desert: Storm Tracker Gear Card
item.comment: FORBIDDEN DESERT: STORM TRACKER GEAR CARD As fun to play as it is to have.

item.name: Forbidden Island
item.comment: FORBIDDEN ISLAND Beautifully produced family game.

item.name: Forbidden Stars
item.comment: FORBIDDEN STARS Great artwork and minis.

item.name: Formula D
item.comment: FORMULA D This reprint of 'Formula De' is just beautiful!!

item.name: Formula D: Circuits 1 – Sebring & Chicago
item.comment: FORMULA D: CIRCUITS 1- SEBRING & CHICAGO More cool tracks.

item.name: Formula D: Circuits 2 – Hockenheim and Valencia
item.comment: FORMULA D CIRCUITS 2- HOCKENHELM AND VALENCIA More cool tracks.

item.name: Formula D: Circuits 3 – Singapore & The Docks
item.comment: FORMULA D: CIRCUITS 3- SINGAPORE & THE DOCKS The Docks track is wild with different routes for each lap (3 total), and you'll never get up to 6th gear on Singapore track with it's many twists and turns!

item.name: Formula Motor Racing
item.comment: FORMULA MOTOR RACING This simple card game with attractive bits is a lot of fun!

item.name: Frag
item.comment: FRAG Plays like Wiz War (which I like better).

item.name: Fresco
item.comment: FRESCO I like this game so much better than 'Pastiche'. It uses a worker placement system rather than a tile laying minigame to collect paints.

item.name: Fresco: Big Box
item.comment: FRESCO: BIG BOX I really like this game and having everything in one box is a plus. I wish they had included a photo on the back of the box top (like the did in the 'Alhambra Big Box') to show where everything goes in the insert. There is a good thread in the forums to help with that though.

item.name: The Fury of Dracula
item.comment: FURY OF DRACULA Cool theme.

item.name: Galaxy Trucker
item.comment: GALAXY TRUCKER The first half of this game is like a puzzle as you build your starship. The second half you watch your ship get blown apart, as you try to complete your run. With all the different options you'll never play the same game twice. Plus the bits are gorgeous!!!

item.name: Galaxy Trucker: Anniversary Edition
item.comment: GALAXY TRUCKER: ANNIVERSARY EDITION If you're new to 'Galaxy Trucker', do yourself a favor and get this beautiful all-in-one set.

item.name: Galaxy Trucker: Another Big Expansion
item.comment: GALAXY TRUCKER: ANOTHER BIG EXPANSION Apart from there being a TON of new stuff, what I really like most is the xenomorph aliens who board your ship and start eating your crew! Of course, your crew is armed and they'll have to get past the auto defense turrets first...

item.name: Galaxy Trucker: Even-Steven Cards
item.comment: GALAXY TRUCKER: EVEN-STEVEN CARDS This cool little promo evens the game difficulty when playing with folks of varying experience levels.

item.name: Galaxy Trucker: The Big Expansion
item.comment: GALAXY TRUCKER: THE BIG EXPANSION Great expansion to a great game.

item.name: Geek Dice
item.comment: GEEK DICE Great looking dice and a nifty idea, but not much of a game. A great way to determine start player though.

item.name: Get Bit!
item.comment: GET BIT I like the robots with the removable limbs. I bought a Lego shark to replace the shark card and it just looks great! Very simple filler.

item.name: Giganten
item.comment: GIGANTEN This oil drilling game was nothing special.

item.name: Good Cop Bad Cop
item.comment: GOOD COP BAD COP Light and fun.

item.name: El Grande
item.comment: EL GRANDE Good area control game. The decennial edition has all the expansions in one box.

item.name: La Granja
item.comment: LA GRANJA Interesting game. I liked how the cards worked differently depending on where you put them on your tableau. What I didn't like was the game length.

item.name: Gravwell: Escape from the 9th Dimension
item.comment: GRAVWELL: ESCAPE FROM THE 9TH DIMENSION Clever strategy game base upon escaping from the gravity well of a black hole. Playing the right card at the right time is crucial.

item.name: The Great Dalmuti
item.comment: THE GREAT DALMUTI Great card game with a large group. It's fun to treat your friends/family like peons.(unless you're one too!)

item.name: The Great Heartland Hauling Co.
item.comment: THE GREAT HEARTLAND HAULING CO. Attactive litle pickup and deliver card game!

item.name: Greed
item.comment: GREED This criminal empire card game makes a good filler. The wooden dollar signs are pretty cool!

item.name: The Grizzled
item.comment: THE GRIZZLED Interesting theme, but too abstract for me.

item.name: Guildhall
item.comment: GUILDHALL Simple, clever, and lots of fun!

item.name: Guildhall: Job Faire
item.comment: GUILDHALL: JOB FAIRE While this stand alone expansion to 'Guildhall' is not necessary it is fun to have the six new professions.

item.name: Guillotine
item.comment: GUILLOTINE Maybe it's not so good to be the king after all!

item.name: Gunrunners
item.comment: GUNRUNNERS Very light filler. Fun but nothing special.

item.name: Hanabi
item.comment: HANABI I don't see what all the fanfare is about. To me there's just not much of a game here. Steller looking cards though.

item.name: Harbour
item.comment: HARBOUR Meh.

item.name: Havoc Expansion: The Character Cards
item.comment: HAVOC EXPANSION: THE CHARACTER CARDS For 2 bucks how could I resist?

item.name: Havoc: The Hundred Years War
item.comment: HAVOC: THE HUNDRED YEARS WAR A lot like poker with points. It's an easy, filler with just a little bit of theme. Fast and fun!

item.name: Le Havre
item.comment: LE HAVRE Despite my rating I might like to try this again.

item.name: Hey, That's My Fish!
item.comment: HEY THAT'S MY FISH! The FFG edition is a great pocket sized filler with excellent components. (Now gimme back my fish!)

item.name: High Society
item.comment: HIGH SOCIETY Fun filler with an auction theme.

item.name: Hunter's Guild: The Vampire Forest
item.comment: HUNTER'S GUILD Decent filler. Could use a few house rules.

item.name: Hurry'Cup!
item.comment: HURRY'CUP! This light game features nice artwork, a short playing time, and is fun. It's among the few dexterity games I actually enjoy.

item.name: Imperial Settlers
item.comment: IMPERIAL SETTLERS This is a very nice looking game, but I need more plays of it before I settle on a final rating. For now it stays a 7.

item.name: Incan Gold
item.comment: INCAN GOLD Boring. Play 'Infiltration' instead. Same mechanisms, better theme, better game.

item.name: Infiltration
item.comment: INFILTRATION Same kind of "stay or go" play as 'Incan Gold', but with so much more! Players are thieves attempting to heist data files from a giant corporation in a futuristic caper.

item.name: Ingenious
item.comment: INGENIOUS Zzzzzzzz...

item.name: Istanbul
item.comment: ISTANBUL I really like this very attractive Eurogame. It is easy to teach, and the turns are so speedy that there is little (if any) downtime. Lots of fun, I highly recommend it.

item.name: Istanbul: Mocha & Baksheesh
item.comment: ISTANBUL: MOCHA & BAKSHEESH Great expansion, especially the coffee.

item.name: It from the Pit
item.comment: IT FROM THE PIT Fun for about 10 minutes.

item.name: JAB: Realtime Boxing
item.comment: JAB: Realtime Boxing Tasty Minstrel Games has done a great job combing a boxing match with a card game. You really need to be fast, or you'll be kissing the canvas!

item.name: Jaipur
item.comment: JAIPUR One of the best 2-player games around.

item.name: Jungle Ascent
item.comment: JUNGLE ASCENT Very basic fller, no action, no excitement. Probably best for kids.

item.name: Kachina
item.comment: KACHINA Cute tile laying filler. 'Voluspa' is a reprint of this.

item.name: Kemet
item.comment: KEMET Nice bits, but I dislike this for the same reasons as 'Cyclades'.

item.name: Key Largo
item.comment: KEY LARGO This is a good family game, and I like the theme of diving for treasure.

item.name: King of New York
item.comment: KING OF NEW YORK A nice step up from 'King of Tokyo'. Alot more deadly, plus it has Captain Fish!

item.name: King of Tokyo
item.comment: KING OF TOKYO Fun dice rolling movie monster game. Best with 6 players, and you just beat the snot out of each other!
item.haspartslist: First edition painted dice in very good condition.

item.name: King of Tokyo Promo Cards
item.comment: KING OF TOKYO PROMO CARDS A great promo with useful cards!

item.name: King of Tokyo: Power Up!
item.comment: KING OF TOKYO: POWER UP Cool mini expansion that adds special powers for each monster. Also includes the deadly Pandakai! I finally won the game thanks to this expansion!

item.name: Kingdom Builder
item.comment: KINGDOM BUILDER After a second play, I appreciate this game much more. Easy to learn and with so many different scoring possiblities, it truly is alot of fun.

item.name: Kingsburg
item.comment: KINGSBURG The dice game with resource gathering and settlement building. Very clever!

item.name: Kingsburg: To Forge a Realm
item.comment: KINGSBURG: TO FORGE A REALM If you enjoy 'Kingsburg' then this is a must buy. Simple rules significantly spice up the base game, especially the new buildings, character cards, and soldier recruitment rules.

item.name: Krosmaster: Arena
item.comment: KROSMASTER: ARENA Cute, but very basic.

item.name: Last Chance
item.comment: LAST CHANCE A better alternative to 'Yahtzee'. Try its' sister game 'Sharp Shooters' too!

item.name: Last Night on Earth: The Zombie Game
item.comment: LAST NIGHT ON EARTH Looks real nice, but plays kind of dull. All is not gold that glitters... (Thanks alot Matt R.!!!)

item.name: Last Will
item.comment: LAST WILL The "Brewster's Millions" Eurogame.

item.name: Leaders of Small World
item.comment: LEADERS OF SMALL WORLD A good expansion.

item.name: Legendary Encounters: An Alien Deck Building Game
item.comment: LEGENDARY ENCOUNTERS: AN ALIEN DECK BUILDING GAME Great theme, but the artwork is a big letdown. I wish they had used actual scenes from the movies on the cards.

item.name: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game
item.comment: LEGENDARY: A MARVEL DECK BUILDING GAME Nice production with fantastic Marvel artwork, unfortunately some card combos (Rogue-Hulk) are potentially game breaking.

item.name: Legendary: Dark City
item.comment: LEGENDARY: DARK CITY I like that each hero card now has different artwork.

item.name: Legendary: Fantastic Four
item.comment: LEGENDARY: FANTASTIC FOUR Galactus, 'nuff said!

item.name: Legendary: Paint the Town Red
item.comment: LEGENDARY: PAINT THE TOWN RED Good expansion with some classic Spiderman villians.

item.name: Legendary: Villains – Marvel Deck Building Game
item.comment: LEGENDARY: VILLIANS While the artwork is better, it's stll basically the same game as the first 'Legendary'.

item.name: Letters from Whitechapel
item.comment: LETTERS FROM WHITECHAPEL I'm so glad Fantasy Flight reprinted this game! The theme of hunting Jack the Ripper is cool!

item.name: Libertalia
item.comment: LIBERTALIA Among the best pirate games out there.

item.name: Lifeboats
item.comment: LIFEBOATS Good game, great bits and the good ol' screw-the-other-guy factor. Best with 6, and NOT for folks who anger easily.

item.name: Lightning: D-Day
item.comment: LIGHTNING: D-DAY Fair Not as good as 'Lightning:Midway'.

item.name: Lightning: Midway – June 4th to June 6th, 1942
item.comment: LIGHTNING: MIDWAY Good, quick, WWII card game. I think it's the best of the 'Lightning' series.

item.name: Lightning: North Africa on to Tobruk!
item.comment: LIGHTNING: NORTH AFRICA Fair. Not as good as 'Lightning: Midway'.

item.name: Lords & Ladies
item.comment: LORDS & LADIES The title may not sound like much, but with the right group this is silly fun.

item.name: Lords of Vegas
item.comment: LORDS OF VEGAS Similar to 'Acquire', but with lots of luck thrown in (which is a good thing because after all you're in Vegas!).

item.name: Lords of Waterdeep
item.comment: LORDS OF WATERDEEP The D&D Eurogame.

item.name: Lords of Waterdeep: Scoundrels of Skullport
item.comment: LORDS OF WATERDEEP: SCOUNDRELS OF SKULLPORT Interesting expansion but I think I prefer just playing the base game.

item.name: Lost Cities
item.comment: LOST CITIES Apart from the nice artwork, there's just not much there.

item.name: Lost Legacy: Flying Garden
item.comment: LOST LEGACY: FLYING GARDEN This set has really great cards. They works even better when added to another Lost Legacy set.

item.name: Lost Legacy: The Starship
item.comment: LOST LEGACY: THE STARSHIP Plays very smilar to 'Love Letter', except for the end game. I have to admit I like the sci fi/fantasy theme better. Future Lost Legacy expansions should prove interesting.

item.name: Love Letter
item.comment: LOVE LETTER Good filler that's one of the new microgames. I refer to it as "Shag the Princess".
item.haspartslist: Red velour Love Letter bag, brand new.

item.name: Love Letter: The Hobbit – The Battle of the Five Armies
item.comment: LOVE LETTER: THE HOBBIT Ok I thought this was a stupid idea too, until I played it. Even if you hated the Hobbit movies the photos on the cards should please any Tolkien fan. The addition of 'the one ring card' and the slight change to the #3 card make a good game even better.

item.name: Macao
item.comment: MACAO Good game.

item.name: Machi Koro
item.comment: MACHI KORO This simple, attractive game can be very addictive! Can't wait for expansions.

item.name: Machi Koro: Gaming Mega Store
item.comment: MACHI KORO: GAMING MEGA STORE Like many promos not necessary, but fun to own.

item.name: Machi Koro: Harbor Expansion
item.comment: MACHI KORO: HARBOR EXPANSION A game changer! Yes there are more great cards in this set, but there is a totally new rule regarding how and when cards are available to buy. If the base game was too light for you try this expansion, it just might make it more like the game you were expecting in the first place.

item.name: Machi Koro: Millionaire's Row
item.comment: MACHI KORO: MILLIONAIRE'S ROW Fun but can be very cutthroat.

item.name: Magic: The Gathering
item.comment: MAGIC THE GATHERING I bought a ton of these cards when they first came out, but never played much. After recently playing Magic on Xbox, I've become interested again. I think I'll keep these cards around longer than I originally intended. Update: Sold the whole sha-bang for $500!

item.name: Mag·Blast (Third Edition)
item.comment: MAG-BLAST Don't overlook this light sci-fi card game. It's a nice filler, and the artwork of John Kovalic is worth the price alone.

item.name: Manila
item.comment: MANILA A light Eurogame with a tense gambling mechanism. Lots of fun!

item.name: Mansions of Madness
item.comment: MANSIONS OF MADNESS Fantastic theme! Creepy scenarios! Daring investigators! Fearsome monsters! Intriguing clues! Clever puzzles! Just one heck of a game!!!

item.name: Mansions of Madness: Forbidden Alchemy
item.comment: MANSIONS OF MADNESS: FORBIDDEN ALCHEMY More scenarios, characters, and monsters for a great game!

item.name: Mansions of Madness: The Yellow Sign
item.comment: MANSIONS OF MADNESS: THE YELLOW SIGN Seems to play a little less linear than other Mansions of Madness scenarios. Fun but tricky.

item.name: Maori
item.comment: MAORI This simple tile laying game is a good little game!

item.name: Mars Attacks: The Dice Game
item.comment: MARS ATTACKS: THE DICE GAME While I could care less about the Mars Attacks theme, this game does make a good filler.

item.name: Martian Dice
item.comment: MARTIAN DICE Quick, fun, filler with really cool looking dice!

item.name: Martians!!!
item.comment: MARTIANS!!! Plays like 'Zombies!!!', but with a few interesting tweaks that make me like it just a tiny bit more.

item.name: Memoir '44
item.comment: MEMOIR '44 Great light war game. Maybe someday I'll get to play all the expansions!

item.name: Memoir '44: Air Pack
item.comment: M'44: AIR PACK Different, but nice to have.

item.name: Memoir '44: Breakthrough
item.comment: M'44: BREAKTHROUGH I prefer the original board, but if a friend has a copy I'll play.

item.name: Memoir '44: Campaign Book Volume 1
item.comment: M'44: CAMPAIGN BOOK VOL. 1 A great resource for scenarios!

item.name: Memoir '44: Campaign Book Volume 2
item.comment: M'44: CAMPAIGN BOOK VOL 2 Another great resource for scenarios!

item.name: Memoir '44: Eastern Front
item.comment: M'44: EASTERN FRONT The Russians are here!!

item.name: Memoir '44: Mediterranean Theater
item.comment: M'44: MEDITERRANEAN THEATER Go Brits!!

item.name: Memoir '44: Pacific Theater
item.comment: M'44: PACIFIC THEATER With this release 'Memoir 44' is basically complete.

item.name: Memoir '44: Terrain Pack
item.comment: M'44: TERRAIN PACK Good expansion. The interchangable terrain makes creating various WWII battles easy. Greatly enhances the replayability of 'Memoir 44'.

item.name: Memoir '44: Winter/Desert Board Map
item.comment: M'44: WINTER/DESERT BOARD Not necessary for play, but a must for purists like myself. I'd rather not play snow/desert scenarios on a forest board.

item.name: Merchant of Venus
item.comment: MERCHANT OF VENUS The only problem I have with this version of MOV is the small cardboard chits. It can be hard to keep track of where everything is which is vital in this game.

item.name: Merchant of Venus (second edition)
item.comment: MERCHANTS OF VENUS (SECOND EDITION) It's great to have this game back in print, and Fantasy Flight has done a fabulous job on this new edition. I prefer the classic version of the game.

item.name: Merchants & Marauders
item.comment: MERCHANTS & MARAUDERS Excellent presentation, but lasts a little too long for what it is.

item.name: Message to the Czar
item.comment: MESSAGE TO THE CZAR The theme doesn't seem like much until you play it. I like the stategy involved, and the unique movement of the couriers.

item.name: Metro
item.comment: METRO This is like a gamers version of 'Tsuro'.

item.name: Mice and Mystics
item.comment: MICE AND MYSTICS I really like this family style dungeon crawl. Adults will appreciate the mechanisms, bits, and artwork. Kids will love the story and action. A very nice production overall!

item.name: Mille Bornes
item.comment: MILLE BORNES Wasn't fun as a kid, and isn't fun now.

item.name: Mission: Red Planet
item.comment: MISSION RED PLANET I like 'Citadels', but 'Mission Red Planet' takes the same mechanism, and makes it a bit more interesting.

item.name: Mission: Red Planet (Second Edition)
item.comment: MISSON:RED PLANET (SECOND EDITION) Great ugrade to a great game. I love the new artwork, and plastic astronauts!

item.name: Monopoly
item.comment: MONOPOLY Get the 'Monopoly Stock Exchange' add on!

item.name: Monty Python Fluxx
item.comment: MONTY PYTHON FLUXX Who gives a Fluxx...

item.name: Moods
item.comment: MOODS You really have to play with the right group to enjoy this. Acting ability is a plus.

item.name: Munchkin
item.comment: MUNCHKIN If you have a good sense of humor you'll enjoy a few games of this. I like the artwork by John Kovalic.

item.name: Munchkin 2: Unnatural Axe
item.comment: MUNCHKIN 2: UNNATURAL AXE Adds more variety, but not necessary.

item.name: Munchkin 3: Clerical Errors
item.comment: MUNCHKIN 3: CLERICAL ERRORS Adds more variety, but not necessary.

item.name: Munchkin 4: The Need for Steed
item.comment: MUNCHKIN 4: THE NEED FOR STEED Adds warhorses, battle cats, and dinosaurs for your munchkin to ride into battle on.

item.name: Munchkin 5: De-Ranged
item.comment: MUNCHKIN 5: DERANGED My AD&D character was a ranger, so this comic portrayal appealed to me.

item.name: Munchkin 6: Demented Dungeons
item.comment: MUNCHKIN 6: DEMENTED DUNGEONS The new dungeon cards make this expansion better than its' predecessors.

item.name: Munchkin Apocalypse
item.comment: MUNCHKIN APOCALYPSE This proves they're finally running out of themes for munchkin.

item.name: Munchkin Cthulhu
item.comment: MUNCHKIN CTHULHU Maybe I'm missing something. I like 'Munchkin', and Cthulhu. I love the artwork of John Kovalic, but this one just didn't seem to be as good as I'd hoped.

item.name: Munchkin Cthulhu 2: Call of Cowthulhu
item.comment: MUNCHKIN CTHULHU 2: THE CALL OF COWTHULHU Something is missing, just like in 'Munckin Cthulhu'.

item.name: Munchkin Dice
item.comment: MUNCHKIN DICE Handy little accessory! I have them in all my core 'Munchkin' sets.

item.name: Munchkin Zombies
item.comment: MUNCHKIN: ZOMBIES I'm getting really sick of zombies...

item.name: Mush
item.comment: MUSH I think this is underrated. It's unique theme is great, and who can resist all those dog dice?

item.name: Nautilus
item.comment: NAUTILUS Another in my growing line of "Looked real good until I played it" line.

item.name: Naval Battles
item.comment: NAVAL BATTLES Light WWII themed card game.. Best with max players.

item.name: Nevermore
item.comment: NEVERMORE Clever card drafting game that is a blast to play. Very nice production!

item.name: Nexus Ops
item.comment: NEXUS OPS A good sci fi war game playable in under 90 minutes. Nice reprint of the Avalon Hill game by Fantasy Flight.

item.name: Niagara
item.comment: NIAGARA This is a great family game, but it may be too light for gamers. Excellent components!

item.name: No Thanks!
item.comment: NO THANKS This is a great filler. Simple, fun, and portable!

item.name: North Wind
item.comment: NORTH WIND Nice nautical retheming of Starship Catan for 4 players. Plays smooth and is quite fun.

item.name: Nuns on the Run
item.comment: NUNS ON THE RUN Light co-op game about nuns sneaking around an abbey.

item.name: Ora et Labora
item.comment: ORA ET LABORA Easier to understand than Le Harve. Uses similar "resource upgrade" mechanic too. I prefer the whiskey side of the board.

item.name: Oregon
item.comment: OREGON Basic tile-laying game with a wild west theme.

item.name: Pandemic
item.comment: Pandemic I like the outbreak mechanism.

item.name: Pandemic Legacy: Season 1
item.comment: PANDEMIC LEGACY Wow!

item.name: Pandemic: On the Brink
item.comment: PANDEMIC: ON THE BRINK Great expansion! I especially like the smaller pawns and the petri dishes.

item.name: Pandemic: The Cure
item.comment: PANDEMIC: THE CURE Attractive looking, but I'd rather be playing the original 'Pandemic'.

item.name: Pass the Pigs
item.comment: PASS THE PIGS Very quick filler that will attract women out of the woodwork. They love those pigs! (Trust me.)

item.name: Pastiche
item.comment: PASTICHE I like artsy theme and the real paintings, but the tile laying mechanism to collect paints feels like it doesn't belon wth the rest of the game. If I'm going to play a game with a painting theme I'd rather play 'Fresco'.

item.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Base Set
item.comment: PATHFINDER ADVENTURE CARD GAME: RISE OF THE RUNELORDS This card game does a very good job of simulating of an RPG. I especially like how characters level up, and all the dice chuckin'!

item.name: Peloponnes
item.comment: PELOPONNES Very, very, plain.

item.name: Pente
item.comment: PENTE I bought my copy damaged for $1.99. The box and board were in good condition, so I just added 4 sets of colored glass stones, and now I have a complete game for a fraction of the original MSRP!

item.name: Perudo
item.comment: LIAR'S DICE One of the easiest to learn dice games around!

item.name: Phoney Baloney
item.comment: PHONEY BALONEY Typical cheap-o party game.

item.name: Pipeline
item.comment: PIPELINE This was Games magazine's Game of the Year in 1992. I had to order it from the manufacturer in Hawaii.. It's an ok game, but since it's out of print I'll keep it.

item.name: Pirate's Cove
item.comment: PIRATE'S COVE Among my favorite pirate games.

item.name: Pit
item.comment: PIT This frantic party card game is best if you get the set that comes with a bell. People love to smack that bell!! (Trust me.)

item.name: Power Grid
item.comment: POWER GRID Fun game with some really interesting mechanisms. The deluxe edtion has a nicer board and bits though.

item.name: Power Grid deluxe: Europe/North America
item.comment: POWER GRID DELUXE I like this. It has a nicer board and bits (except for the electro) than the original game.

item.name: Power Grid: Factory Manager
item.comment: POWER GRID: FACTORY MANAGER I didn't like the original Power Grid, but this version is a little better.

item.name: The Princes of Florence
item.comment: THE PRINCES OF FLORENCE Good Eurogame with room for many different winning strategies.

item.name: Prophecy
item.comment: PROPHECY I can't say if it's better or worse than 'Talisman', just different.

item.name: Prophecy: Dragon Realm
item.comment: PROPHECY: DRAGON REALM Meh. Simply makes Prophecy longer. Board is misprinted too.

item.name: Puerto Rico
item.comment: PUERTO RICO Good game.

item.name: Puerto Rico Expansion
item.originalname: Puerto Rico: Expansion I – New Buildings
item.comment: PUERTO RICO EXPANSION Not necessary.

item.name: Puzzle Strike (Third Edition)
item.comment: PUZZLE STRIKE Very confusing (fight?) game. I don't know, I just don't get it.

item.name: Quarriors!
item.comment: QUARRIORS! Good, simple, fun dice collecting game. Maybe someday they'll make the dice engraved in 16mm.

item.name: Queen's Architect
item.comment: QUEEN'S ARCHITECT This game can be rather tricky to learn because it is rather mechanism heavy. That being said, after a few turns you do start to pick it up and it's fun.

item.name: Ra
item.comment: RA Good game.

item.name: Ra: The Dice Game
item.comment: RA: THE DICE GAME Play the board game instead!

item.name: Race for the Galaxy
item.comment: RACE FOR THE GALAXY Too many icons!

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: Rebel vs Imperium
item.comment: RACE FOR THE GALAXY: REBEL VS IMPERIUM Enough with the friggin' icons already!!

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: The Gathering Storm
item.comment: RACE FOR THE GALAXY: THE GATHERING STORM Still too many icons!!

item.name: Rage
item.comment: RAGE When I bought this it was an all-time best seller at an on-line game store. Damned if I know why...

item.name: The Red Dragon Inn
item.comment: THE RED DRAGON INN A simple game about a band of adventurers drinking and gambling in an inn after a dungeon crawl. Cute idea, but not much to it.

item.name: Red November
item.comment: RED NOVEMBER I really enjoy this sink or swim co-op game! The submarine theme is unique, and now that Fantasy Flight has published a version with an actual board instead of a paper map, it's $30 well spent!

item.name: Red7
item.comment: RED7 This slick little card game is great!

item.name: Relic
item.comment: Relic This beautiful production is like 'Talisnan' with a 'Warhammer 40k' theme. Unfortunately it's a long slog if the dice hate you.

item.name: The Resistance
item.comment: THE RESISTANCE This game is a blast when played with the right group. The mission scoring is unique. Second edition has improved bits.

item.name: The Resistance: Hidden Agenda & Hostile Intent
item.comment: THE RESISANCE: HIDDEN AGENDA & HOSTILE INTENT After playing 'The Resistance' numerous times, it's nice to have an expansion in which I can easily throw in a few cards and vary gameplay.

item.name: The Resistance: Hostile Intent
item.comment: THE RESISTANCE: HOSTILE INTENT After playing 'The Resistance' numerous times, it's nice to have an exansion where I can easily throw a few cards in and vary gamelay.

item.name: The Resistance: Merlin/Assassin Promo
item.comment: THE RESISTANCE: MERLIN/ ASSASSIN PROMO This promo was given out on Tabletop day, and features characters from the Avalon version of the game moderized so you can add them to your regular 'Resistance' set. An interesting idea.

item.name: Rex: Final Days of an Empire
item.comment: REX I never played 'Dune', but if it's anything like 'Rex' its got to be good! Fantasy Flight did a great job switching the theme into the 'Twilight Imperium' universe.

item.name: Ricochet Robots
item.comment: RICOCHET ROBOTS This might make a good puzzle, but as a boardgame it stinks. Play 'Roborally' instead.

item.name: Risk
item.comment: RISK I still have my set from 1980. I'm not into any of the movie tie-in editions though.

item.name: Risk Legacy
item.comment: RISK LEGACY Fun, version of 'Risk' with an everchanging board and cards. Rules are streamlined so games only take an hour or two.

item.name: Ristorante Italia
item.comment: RISTORANTE ITALIA Great family game about running your own italian resturant. Loaded with theme!

item.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
item.comment: ROBINSON CRUSOE: ADVENTURE ON THE CURSED ISLAND Fun but brutal.

item.name: RoboRally
item.comment: ROBORALLY I have the newer edition with some pre-set map suggestions. Makes for much quicker games. Unfortunately the plastic robots are all gray, and need to be painted.

item.name: Roll for the Galaxy
item.comment: ROLL FOR THE GALAXY Now this is the game I hoped 'Race for the Galaxy' would be. Icons with detailed explanations, great player aids, beautiful artwork and components. A much better game than Race in my opinion.

item.name: Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
item.comment: ROLL THROUGH THE AGES I'm hooked!

item.name: Roll Through the Ages: The Iron Age
item.comment: ROLL THROUGH THE AGES: THE IRON AGE Different mechanics require a whole new strategy to win this game, and may take you a while to to get used to if you've played 'RTTA: THE BRONZE AGE'. Still lots of fun though.

item.name: Rook
item.comment: ROOK Zzzzzzzzzzz....

item.name: Rumis
item.comment: RUMIS Interesting abstract game.

item.name: Run, Fight, or Die!
item.comment: RUN, FIGHT, OR DIE Fun and innovative zombie game.

item.name: Runebound (Second Edition)
item.comment: RUNEBOUND This game is best played with 2 or 3. Otherwise there is too much downtime between turns, and the game will drag on and on. I also recommend using the doom track variant, which acts as a game clock.

item.name: Runebound: Avatars of Kelnov
item.comment: RUNEBOUND: AVATARS OF KELNOV Adventure Variant Deck

item.name: Runebound: Champions of Kellos
item.comment: RUNEBOUND: CHAMPIONS OF KELLOS Item and Ally Card Deck

item.name: Runebound: Cult of the Rune
item.comment: RUNEBOUND: CULT OF THE RUNE Adventure Variant Deck

item.name: Runebound: Drakes and Dragonspawn
item.comment: RUNEBOUND: DRAKES AND DRAGONSPAWN Challange Card Deck

item.name: Runebound: The Dark Forest
item.comment: RUNEBOUND: THE DARK FOREST Challenge Card Deck

item.name: Runebound: The Scepter of Kyros
item.comment: RUNEBOUND: THE SCEPTER OF KYROS Adventure Variant Deck

item.name: Runebound: Walkers of the Wild
item.comment: RUNEBOUND: WALKERS OF THE WILD Item and Ally Card Deck

item.name: Saboteur
item.comment: SABOTEUR Ok card game, nothing special.

item.name: San Juan
item.comment: SAN JUAN Better than 'Race for the Galaxy' if only for not having to deal with all the damn icons!!

item.name: Savannah Tails
item.comment: SAVANNAH TAILS This quick race game is easy to play, and the theme is certainly unique. Onward Mathilda!

item.name: Savannah Tails: Pachyderm Passage
item.comment: SAVANNAH TAILS: PACHYDERM PASSAGE This expansion tile adds elephants to the race track which no ostrich can go through (even special abilities). Mine was included in the base game.

item.name: The Seafarers of Catan
item.comment: THE SEAFARERS OF CATAN The version of 'Catan' I play the least.

item.name: The Seafarers of Catan: 5-6 Player Expansion
item.comment: CATAN: SEAFARERS 5-6 PLAYER EXPANSION Good, but 5 and 6 players can really slow down the game.

item.name: Seasons
item.comment: SEASONS Easy but challenging game with big chunky dice. Very attractive looking!

item.name: Seasons: Enchanted Kingdom
item.comment: SEASONS: ENCHANTED KINGDOM Yay, more Seasons!

item.name: Seasons: Path of Destiny
item.comment: SEASONS: PATH OF DESTINY The destiny die rocks!

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse
item.comment: SENTINELS OF THE MULTIVERSE Just like you're in a comic book! UPDATE: Upgraded to Enhanced edition.

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse
item.comment: SENTINELS OF THE MULTIVERSE: ENHANCED EDITION This is a must-buy if you love Sentinels. The whole things looks beautiful with new card design, hp tokens, and attack modifier tokens. Also it will hold (almost) everything in the Multiverse!

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Ambuscade Villain Character
item.comment: SENTINELS OF THE MULTIVERSE: AMBUSCADE VILLIAN CHARACTER Cool looking villian.

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Dark Visionary Promo Card
item.comment: SENTINELS OF THE MULTIVERSE: DARK VISIONARY PROMO CARD She reminds me of the Dark Phoeneix in X-Men.

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Infernal Relics
item.comment: SENTINELS OF THE MULTIVERSE: iNFERNAL RELICS More heroes and villians (this time a whole evil team)!

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Miss Information Villain Character
item.comment: SENTINELS OF THE MULTIVERSE: MISS INFORMATION VILLIAN CHARACTER Looks wimpy but you never know with some of these SOTM villians. Have to see how she plays.

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Rook City
item.comment: SENTINELS OF THE MULTIVERSE: ROOK CITY Lots more Sentinels fun with a few rule and card improvements.

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Shattered Timelines
item.comment: SENTINELS OF THE MULTIVERSE: SHATTERED TIMELINES Kickstarted this and got lots of cool extra stuff!

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Silver Gulch, 1883 Environment
item.comment: SENTINELS OF THE MULTIVERSE: SILVER GULTCH 1883 ENVIORMENT CARD Oh no! We've been transported back in time!

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: The Eternal Haka Promo Card
item.comment: SENTINELS OF THE MULTIVERSE: tHE ETERNAL HAKA PROMO CARD Haka rocks...eternally.

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: The Final Wasteland Environment
item.comment: SENTINELS OF THE MULTIVERSE: THE FINAL WASTELAND ENVIORMENT Ultimate showdown at the end of time.

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: The Scholar Hero Character
item.comment: SENTINELS OF THE MULTIVERSE: THE SCHOLAR HERO CHARACTER Not crazy about the name, but the powers look good.

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: The Super Scientific Tachyon Promo Card
item.comment: SENTINELS OF THE MULTIVERSE: THE SUPER SCIENTIFIC TACHYON PROMO CARD I was lucky enough to get this promo from a friend!

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Unity Hero Character
item.comment: SENTINELS OF THE MULTIVERSE: UNITY HERO CHARACTER Always good to have more heroes. Alternate Unity card arrived with "Shattered Timelines" Kickstarter.

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Vengeance
item.comment: SENTINELS OF THE MULTIVERSE: VENGEANCE The multiverse keeps expanding!

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Wrath of the Cosmos
item.comment: SENTINELS OF THE MULTIVERSE: WRATH OF THE COSMOS Another great set, I just wish they had included over-sized villian cards.

item.name: SET
item.comment: SET Abstract card game. Nothing special.

item.name: The Settlers of Catan
item.comment: THE SETTLERS OF CATAN Fun once in a while.

item.name: The Settlers of Catan: 5-6 Player Expansion
item.comment: THE SETTLERS OF CATAN: 5-6 PLAYER EXTENSION Good, but 5 and 6 players can really slow down the game.

item.name: The Settlers of Catan: The Fishermen of Catan
item.comment: THE SETTLERS OF CATAN: THE FISHERMEN OF CATAN Good mini expansion.

item.name: The Settlers of Catan: The Great River
item.comment: THE SETTLERS OF CATAN: THE GREAT RIVER Ok mini expansion.

item.name: The Settlers of the Stone Age
item.comment: THE SETTLERS OF THE STONE AGE I am really getting sick of Catan.

item.name: Shadowrift
item.comment: SHADOWRIFT I like the co-op mechanism in this deck builder.

item.name: Shadows over Camelot
item.comment: SHADOWS OVER CAMELOT Fun game that always reminds me of "Monty Python and the Holy Grail".

item.name: Shadows over Camelot: Merlin's Company
item.comment: SHADOWS OVER CAMELOT: MERLIN'S COMPANY Good expansion for a really fun game.

item.name: Sharp Shooters
item.comment: SHARP SHOOTERS A better alternative to 'Yahtzee'. Try its' sister game 'Last Chance' too!

item.name: Sheriff of Nottingham
item.comment: SHERIFF OF NOTTTINGHAM This game is fun if you have the right group of people. You reaally have to have players highly involved in the theme.

item.name: Shogun
item.comment: SHOGUN First play was so-so, but I hope things will get better. UPDATE: Nope.

item.name: Shootin' Ladders: Frag Fest
item.comment: SHOOTIN' LADDERS I'd rather play Frag.

item.name: Shuttles
item.comment: SHUTTLES 2 player maze game with a twist - the walls move!

item.name: Skyline
item.comment: SKYLINE You get 60 (yes 60!) dice and try to build the tallest buildings. Looks nce but is kind of boring.

item.name: Slide 5
item.comment: SLIDE 5 Quick and easy family card game.

item.name: Small World
item.comment: SMALL WORLD I love the light hearted theme of this easy area control game. Commando Dwarves Rock!!

item.name: Small World Realms
item.comment: SMALL WORLD REALMS The different scenarios, and various board setups can really spice things up if you're tired of playing on the original maps from the base game.

item.name: Small World Underground
item.comment: SMALL WORLD UNDERGROUND Board looks muddled, extra rules complicate game.

item.name: Small World: Be Not Afraid...
item.comment: SMALL WORLD: BE NOT AFRAID This adds more races and powers, and includes a nice tray to hold all the other expansions too.

item.name: Small World: Cursed!
item.comment: SMALL WORLD: CURSED More races and powers.

item.name: Small World: Grand Dames of Small World
item.comment: SMALL WORLD: GRAND DAMES OF SMALL WORLD More races and powers.

item.name: Small World: Necromancer Island
item.comment: SMALL WORLD: NECROMANCER ISLAND The necromancer takes the dead units of the other players, and replaces them with his ghost units. If he can get all his ghosts on the board before the last turn he wins! Fun mini expansion.

item.name: Small World: Tales and Legends
item.comment: SMALL WORLD: TALES AND LEGENDS Basically an event deck with wild effects for each turn.

item.name: Smash Up
item.comment: SMASH UP This cool little card game features aliens, dinosaurs, and more fighting for control of various bases. Very easy and fun, I can't wait for more factions!

item.name: Smash Up: Awesome Level 9000
item.comment: SMASH UP: AWESOME LEVEL 9000 Another 4 factions for 'Smash Up' (yea bear calvary!), plus some much needed points tokens to keep score.

item.name: Smash Up: Science Fiction Double Feature
item.comment: SMASH UP: SCIENCE FICTION DOUBLE FEATURE Cyborg apes! 'Nuff said.

item.name: Snow Tails
item.comment: SNOW TAILS This racing game has a great theme, and steering the sled can be tricky for some. Look out for the trees!

item.name: Snow Tails: The Leap of Death
item.comment: SNOW TAILS: THE LEAP OF DEATH This extra tile adds a bit of a thrill to your 'Snow Tails' races, and is fun to own. Mine was included with the base game.

item.name: Sorry!
item.comment: SORRY For the kids (who else?).

item.name: Space Alert
item.comment: SPACE ALERT This real-time (as in you have 10 minutes to complete your mission or you're dead) is a blast! It comes with 2 CDs, but it's more convienient to download an MP3 version of the soundtrack on to your smart phone.

item.name: Space Alert: The New Frontier
item.comment: SPACE ALERT: THE NEW FRONTIER More missions and hazards, but I eally bought this for the cool crew badges.

item.name: Space Cadets
item.comment: SPACE CADETS Innovative, but tends to run long and is difficult to teach. I much prefer Space Cadets Dice Duel.

item.name: Space Cadets Promo Pack
item.comment: SPACE CADETS PROMO PACK The best part of this promo is the little plastic starship that replaces the tile from the base game.

item.name: Space Cadets: Dice Duel
item.comment: SPACE CADETS: DICE DUEL This is the game the original 'Space Cadets' should have been! Easier to teach and play, and only takes about 30 minutes to complete. We played a game with 10, and it was the wildest half hour I've had in a long time!

item.name: Space Cadets: Dice Duel – Die Fighter
item.comment: SPACE CADETS: DICE DUEL- DIE FIGHTER Greatly enhances 'Dice Duel'! The fighters are cool!

item.name: Space Hulk
item.comment: SPACE HULK (SECOND ED.) This game always reminds me of the movie "Aliens". I like to play the space marines.

item.name: Specter Ops
item.comment: SPECTER OPS Just like a video game! Challenging and fun.

item.name: The Speicherstadt
item.comment: THE SPEICHERSTADT Fun, light Eurogame about a German warehouse.

item.name: The Spirits of Niagara
item.comment: THE SPIRITS OF NIAGARA Good expansion for 'Niagara'.

item.name: Splendor
item.comment: SPLENDOR A top notch production!

item.name: Spyfall
item.comment: SPYFALL It's really hard to be the spy, and Cryptozoic sould have included player aids listing all locatons. This game is just not for me.

item.name: Star Munchkin
item.comment: STAR MUNCHKIN Muunchkiins iin spaace!

item.name: Star Munchkin 2: The Clown Wars
item.comment: STAR MUNCHKIN 2: THE CLOWN WARS Begun the Clown Wars have...

item.name: Star Realms
item.comment: STAR REALMS Fun card game similar to 'Ascension', but with a better theme.

item.name: Star Realms: BGG Store Promo Set One
item.comment: STAR REALMS: PROMO SET ONE Like many promos, cool to own but not necessary.

item.name: Star Realms: Crisis – Bases & Battleships
item.comment: STAR REALMS: CRISIS- BASES & BATTLESHIPS More cards! More cards!

item.name: Star Realms: Crisis – Events
item.comment: STAR REALMS: CRISIS- EVENTS More cards! More cards!

item.name: Star Realms: Crisis – Fleets & Fortresses
item.comment: STAR REALMS: CRISIS- FLEETS & FORTRESSES More cards! More cards!

item.name: Star Realms: Crisis – Heroes
item.comment: STAR REALMS: CRISIS- HEROES More cards! More cards!

item.name: Star Realms: Promo Set Two
item.comment: STAR REALMS: ROMO SET TWO Like many promos, cool to own but not necessary.

item.name: Star Trek Deck Building Game: The Next Generation
item.comment: STAR TREK: DECK BUILDING GAME Fun game if you're a Star Trek fan. Seems to slow down though with too many people.

item.name: Star Wars Customizable Card Game
item.comment: STAR WARS CCG I sunk a chunk of change into these, and bought the entire first run. Never played, they are currently all boxed up and stored in my massive Star Wars collection.

item.name: Star Wars: Imperial Assault
item.comment: STAR WARS: IMPERIAL ASSAULT This plays very similar to 'Descent 2.0', but with many simple improvements. It's lots of fun, and if I wasn't so heavily invested in 'Descent' I'd probably buy it. Excellent game!

item.name: Star Wars: The Card Game
item.comment: STAR WARS: THE CARD GAME It took me two plays to fully understand and appreciate this game. Underneath the great artwork there is a solid game that's fun to play.

item.name: Star Wars: X-Wing
item.comment: STAR WARS: X-WING MINIATURES A decent introductory miniatures game. I give a "9" for the minis and a "7" for the actual game.

item.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – A-Wing Expansion Pack
